marketNews.title: Upstream Oil and Gas Investment in Indonesia +13% YoY in FY23, Lifting Below Target
marketNews.content:
SKK Migas has released a report on the realization of investment and performance of the upstream oil and gas sector in Indonesia during 2023. Details:
- Investment grew +13% YoY to USD 13.7 billion, surpassing global upstream oil and gas investment growth of around +6.5% YoY and marking the largest upstream investment in Indonesia in the last 8 years.
- Oil lifting fell -1.1% YoY to 605.5 thousand barrels of oil per day (MBOPD), equal to 92.5% of the 2023 APBN target and 98% of the SKK Migas 2023 target.
- Gas flow increased +0.6% YoY to 5,378 million standard cubic feet per day (MMSCFD), equal to 87% of the 2023 APBN target and 96.5% of the SKK Migas 2023 target.
- During 2023, Indonesia also discovered two giant oil and gas blocks, Geng North and Layaran. Both blocks are among the five largest oil and gas block discoveries worldwide in 2023, and represent the largest Indonesian discoveries since 2000.

SKK Migas Chairman Dwi Soetjipto said the increase in investment in 2023—especially for development well drilling—has been able to reduce the rate of oil production decline and increase gas production in Indonesia.

For 2024, the following targets are set:
- Oil lifting of 596 MBOPD based on the SKK Migas 2024 target and 635 MBOPD based on the APBN 2024 target.
- Gas flow of 5,544 MMSCFD based on the SKK Migas 2024 target and 5,785 MMSCFD based on the APBN 2024 target.
- Upstream investment to increase +29.2% YoY to USD 17.7 billion.

Key Takeaway
The rising trend of upstream oil and gas investment in Indonesia could have a positive impact on service providers in the oil and gas sector through increased work volume and better service rates, ultimately growing revenue and net profit.

On the IDX, several service providers are $ELSA, $APEX, $WINS, $LEAD, $RUIS, $BBRM, and $HITS. Stockbit also released Mini Unboxing WINS and Mini Unboxing ELSA discussing the prospects and challenges of those two stocks.

marketNews.title: CTRA: Marketing Sales FY23 +24% YoY, Exceeds Target
marketNews.content:
- CTRA: Ciputra Development recorded marketing sales growth of +24% YoY to IDR 10.2 trillion in FY23. This realization exceeded the FY23 target (105%) of IDR 9.8 trillion, marking the highest marketing sales in the company's history. Residential house sales contributed 80% of total FY23 marketing sales, followed by shophouses (17%), apartments (2%), and offices (1%).
- PANI: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua controller, PT Multi Artha Pratama, absorbed 2.02 billion PANI shares at IDR 5,000 per share between 6-15 December 2023. Total transaction value reached IDR 10.11 trillion. After this transaction, PT Multi Artha Pratama's ownership in PANI increased from 88.07% to 89.2%. The transaction is part of a rights issue worth IDR 10.5 trillion conducted by PANI in December 2023.
- JARR: Jhonlin Agro Raya signed a biodiesel supply contract worth IDR 1.65 trillion with PT Pertamina Patra Niaga. The contract runs from 1 January to 31 December 2024.
- ELPI: The President Director of Pelayaran Nasional Ekalya Purnamasari, Eka Taniputra, said the company will allocate capex of IDR 1 trillion for 2024. The funds will be used to add seven new vessels: 2 anchor handling tug and supply (AHTS) units, 2 landing craft transport (LCT) units, and 3 fast crew vessels. Through its business entity PT Samudra Luas Sejahtera Abadi, ELPI will also add one mother vessel supramax.
- AKRA: Controlling shareholder of AKR Corporindo, PT Arthakencana Rayatama, bought approximately 8.32 million AKRA shares at an average price of IDR 1,550.9 per share between 2-11 January 2024. Total transaction value about IDR 12.89 billion. After this transaction, PT Arthakencana Rayatama's ownership in AKRA rose from 60.18% to 60.22%.

marketNews.title: What to Watch For
marketNews.content:
Several economic data releases are scheduled for this week (15-19 January 2024):
- Monday (15/1): Indonesia's December trade balance (USD 3.3 billion, November: USD 2.41 billion)
- Wednesday (17/1): China Q4 2023 GDP YoY (consensus: 5.3%, Q3 2023: 4.9%)
- Wednesday (17/1): China December house price index YoY (forecast: -0.4%, November: -0.2%)
- Wednesday (17/1): China December industrial production YoY (consensus: 6.6%, November: 6.6%)
- Wednesday (17/1): China December retail sales YoY (consensus: 8%, November: 10.1%)
- Wednesday (17/1): China December inflation YoY (forecast: 5%, November: 5%)
- Wednesday (17/1): China December unemployment rate YoY (forecast: 5%, November: 5%)
- Wednesday (17/1): Indonesia December credit growth YoY (December: 9.74%)
- Wednesday (17/1): Bank Indonesia policy rate (consensus: 6%, December: 6%)

Economic data released last week (8-12 January 2024):
- Indonesia: December motor sales YoY (-11.6% vs. November -2.8%)
- Indonesia: December foreign exchange reserves (USD 146.4 billion vs. November 138.1 billion)
- Indonesia: December consumer confidence index (123.8 vs. November 123.6)
- United States: November trade balance (USD -63.2 billion vs. October -64.5 billion)
- Indonesia: November retail sales YoY (2.1% vs. October 2.4%)
- United States: November core inflation YoY (3.9% vs. October 4%)
- United States: November inflation YoY (3.4% vs. October 3.1%)
- China: December inflation YoY (-0.3% vs. November -0.5%)
- China: December trade balance (USD 75.3 billion vs. November 68.3 billion)
- United Kingdom: November GDP YoY (0.2% vs. October -0.1%)

marketNews.title: Economic Data Released Last Week (8-12 January 2024)
marketNews.content:
BPS reported that Indonesia's trade surplus reached USD 3.3 billion in December 2023 (vs. December 2022: USD 3.96 billion), surpassing the consensus estimate of USD 1.92 billion. Exports in December 2023 fell -5.76% YoY, while imports fell -3.81% YoY. Throughout 2023, Indonesia's trade surplus was USD 36.93 billion (vs. 2022: USD 54.46 billion), with exports down -11.33% and imports down -6.55%.

The government announced that it will continue the rice social assistance program (bansos) at 10 kg per month until June 2024, targeting 22 million beneficiary families to mitigate rice price inflation caused by El Niño. The assistance has been distributed since September 2023.

Bloomberg reported that Lion Air (PT Lion Mentari Airlines) is considering an IPO on the IDX with a fundraising target of USD 300-500 million. Lion Air previously planned an IPO in 2019 but cancelled it due to Covid-19. In response, the IDX Corporate Valuation Director, I Gede Nyoman Yetna, said Lion Air is not in the IPO pipeline for this year.

Supreme Cable Manufacturing & Commerce (SCCO) plans a 1:4 stock split, with the new nominal price trading on the regular market and negotiations scheduled for 8 March 2024. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 20 February 2024.
